content: What specific beliefs must they have? can the be pro choice and avoid the RINO label so long as the are for lower taxes? or is it an all or nothing deal? as in you must follow they party platform fully? Or is it merely party loyalty? As in can you follow the party platform yet criticize the party does that make you a RINO? what specifically makes someone a RINO?

title: What makes some one a RINO?

content: Perhaps people on here that are more intelligent than I (and that's pretty much anyone!) can give a better explanation. But... I don't think you will find your "checklist". Rather, I think this is the sort of thing that develops over time. Much like being a good father or a good husband. It's not something that you can quantify. It's something that is demonstrated by track record. And, yes, those issues of abortion, big govt, gun control, fiscal responsibility, personal responsibility, etc. are all very important. These things get developed over a period of time by voting and other public stances. I'm not sure a convenient little checklist where there are ten items where all or 5 or 8 have to be checked in order to arrive at the label. It's more about a philosophy of life than it is about putting X's in a box.
reply: Perhaps people on here that are more intelligent than I (and that's pretty much anyone!) can give a better explanation. But... I don't think you will find your "checklist". title: What makes some one a RINO?

content: Definition: Republican In Name Only, or RINO, is a neologism created by Los Angeles conservative activist Celeste Greig. It is considered a disparaging term for a member of the Republican Party of the United States (the GOP) whose political views or actions are perceived as insufficiently conservative or otherwise outside the party mainstream. -------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------- I don't think that there is a "checklist" either 249. We can all be preceived, in the political sense, as being a Centurists however. That is a person that can see both sides.

title: What makes some one a RINO?

content: Example of a RINO: Barry Goldwater, Republican Presidential candidate 1964 Believed in balanced budgets and no deficit spending = RINO. Was pro-choice = RINO. Was not a member of a evangelical fundamentalist Protestant church = RINO.

content: A RINO is an old friend who have the effrontery to disagree with a 'real' republican on some issue. What really vorries me is that seeing how republicans are the only REAL Americans. and the number of republicans are dwindling so fast from so many either deserting or getting thrown out, what will happen when the number of REAL republicans (== REAL Americans) reach zero ? Will the United states go poof and disappear ? "Good is better than bad cause its nicer" Mammy Yokum (as related by Al Capp)
